name: Poker at Berkeley
description:
Poker at Berkeley intends to bring the Poker community at Berkeley together through events, socials, and providing educational resources. Players of all skill levels are encouraged to get involved!

Members of Poker at Berkeley also teach the Introduction to Poker Decal, Stat 198. The Decal intends to take students from having little to no experience to being able to win against their friends and at most low stake games. The course focuses on understanding the probabilistic and heuristic aspects of playing effective poker.

The club serves a separate purpose from the Decal, with the Decal being intended to educate newer players while Poker at Berkeley primarily focuses on holding events. Poker at Berkeley hopes to build a strong community of players on campus through a variety of offerings to help students of all backgrounds get involved.

Poker at Berkeley understands the ethical implications of gambling. At no point during any event affiliated with Poker at Berkeley will students be required or encouraged to wager real money. Poker at Berkeley further intends to provide resources for students concerned about their relationship with gambling.

Some offerings that we plan to continue building out include:

  • Semesterly large-scale multi-day poker tournaments open to members
  • Smaller-scale club socials and sponsored events
  • A vibrant online community via our Discord server
  • Access to club poker solver software and computing resources
  • Club coaching, study groups, and hand reviews to improve at the game
summary: Poker at Berkeley intends to bring the Poker community at Berkeley together through events, socials, and providing educational resources. Players of all skill levels are encouraged to get involved!
